description:
An unfortunate high school student, Ayasaki Hayate spends his days working at part-time jobs to support his extravagant parents. After incurring a debt of 150 million yen, they disappear, and Hayate was left holding the bag. Whilst running away from the debt collectors, he tries to kidnap a girl for ransom (however, the girl misunderstands his intentions and thinks he is confessing his love to her). Almost immediately, he botches the kidnap attempt but then manages to save her from other kidnappers, causing her to fall in love with him. The girl, Sanzenin Nagi, is actually the daughter of a millionaire family. In recognition of his services, she hires Hayate as a resident butler and even pays off the debt collectors.
This is how Hayate becomes a combat butler. In order to serve and protect his mistress, Hayate's life-or-death butler life begins.

(Source: AnimeNfo)

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

node.description:
__Date of Birth:__ 1976
__Place of Birth:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Doujin Circle:__ DO-RAKU7  

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usatsukaeiji)

**Eiji Usatsuka** is a Japanese light novel illustrator. He is notable for the illustration for the series Zero no Tsukaima. He illustrates insert images for many novels.   

After university graduation he was employed as illustrator by the visual novel publisher Visual Art's using the pseudonym Sawagani (サワガニ, Japanese Freshwater Crab). As side job he made illustrations for light novels which is against the company policy. The similarity of "both peoples" designs, were however noticed and later revealed by Tōya Okano (scenario assistant for Visual Art's' Clannad) in a Dengeki G's Magazine interview article presenting Visual Art's brand Mana's game Angel Magister.  

 (Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dochibibi) Yukiko Horiguchi is an animator, illustrator and character designer formerly belonging to Kyoto Animation. She joined Kyoto Animation in 2003 after graduating from a junior college (tanki daigaku). She started as inbetweener on Shin-Chan, before making a debut as key animator on the KyoAni in-house OVA Munto. In 2007 she was given the chance to design characters for the anime adaptation of the Lucky Star yon-koma manga. Horiguchi is particularly known for the shape she gives her drawings, resulting in a certain roundness and the distinctly fine outline and peculiar shading. Her characters appear to be very child-like and cute, and full of energy, which is a major appeal to the fans. The illustrator [BUNBUN](https://anilist.co/staff/112785) is her younger brother.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hatakenjiro) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/hajimemashite_maru/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/15184753)

Kenjirou Hata is a Japanese manga author. He is notable for the creation of the series Hayate the Combat Butler. He likes to collect anime related items, such as figurines. He was once an assistant of [Kouji Kumeta](https://anilist.co/staff/97662/Kouji-Kumeta).  

He is married to the voice actress [Masumi Asano](https://anilist.co/staff/95077/Masumi-Asano).

An illustrator who works primarily for KeroQ and Makura.
